name: Discussion Game
description:
It was one of those dull, unremarkable mornings in an average, unremarkable company in the downtown of a big city… Sleepy secretary was seeping her half-cold coffee desperately trying to concentrate on work. It seemed that nothing could change this sluggish course of office life ... when suddenly the silence of the office space was interrupted with an indignant shout of the boss: “Everyone! To my office! Now!"  

Nobody knows exactly what happened next, only the secretary could hear snippets of phrases coming from the boss's office ...  

 

".. you had only one, ONE (!) single task - to find the answer to this question .."  

".. well, this is a VERY unusual question, no argue... BUT such clients never come twice.. if we fail the project, the news about our failure will bury the remnants of our unfortunate company forever.."  

 

“.. how could it be possible that there is no clear answer? It is 21st century…technologies… Elon Musk is about to teleport humans to Mars.. and you cannot solve this simple question... "  

“.. what do you mean you cannot agree with each other?! you are professionals ..!! "  

 

“… I don't want to discuss it anymore! You have 24 hours, so come to an agreement between all of you somehow .. "  

 

This is how the story of this meeting began… when four colleagues had to solve one of the most ancient philosophical problems ... "which came first: a chicken or an egg?”  

[’NEXT’ button]  

 

[the player sees the main screen with 4 characters sitting around the table]  

[text typed in the bottom of the screen] 

So.. here you are, at the meeting of these four poor fellows who need to untangle the dilemma that has been debated for thousands of years…   

Each of them is a high-rank professional but their perspectives about the solution to the question are quite diverse…and, as all humans being complicated, they struggle to find a common language for communication.  

Your only task is to keep the discussion going in a balanced way, so that everyone is heard, and they progress to shared understanding of the solution. Ready to challenge yourself?
